headline: KPop Demon Hunters Deal and New HQ Could Be a Game Changer for Hasbro (HAS)
summary: Hasbro recently reported fiscal third quarter results surpassing expectations, raised its full-year guidance to high single-digit revenue growth, and announced it will pay a US$0.70 per share dividend on December 3, 2025, with the shareholder record date of November 19, 2025. Netflix announced that Hasbro and Mattel will serve as global toy licensees for the hit animated film KPop Demon Hunters, while Hasbro outlined an extensive pipeline of 45–50 entertainment projects and will relocate its...

headline: Tariff Impact Mixed, Mostly Moderate, So Far In Q3 Earnings
summary: Investors are no longer giving companies a free pass on guidance for tariffs, as they had in earlier earnings seasons.

raw.headline: Tariff Impact Mixed, Mostly Moderate, So Far In Q3 Earnings
raw.summary: Investors are no longer giving companies a free pass on guidance for tariffs, as they had in earlier earnings seasons.

headline: Hasbro (HAS) Valuation in Focus After Strong Earnings Beat and Upgraded Growth Guidance
summary: Hasbro (HAS) caught investors’ attention after its latest earnings release beat Wall Street estimates, fueled by an 8% year-over-year jump in quarterly revenue. The company credited its Wizards of the Coast and digital gaming segments for much of this momentum. See our latest analysis for Hasbro. Hasbro’s momentum is catching Wall Street’s eye, and it is not just quarterly revenue that has turned heads. The share price has rallied 38% year-to-date, shaking off tariff worries and supply chain...

headline: Hasbro, Mattel signal retail orders to bounce back for the holidays
summary: The companies are expecting a strong finish to the year after delays in purchasing weighed on company revenues. Hasbro is also leveraging its U.S. operations and moving away from China.
